name: Nakia Byrd
text: If I could leave 0 stars I would. How is it this is a new location and it seems the night shift on certain nights is A HOT A!! MESS!!! Is this what work looks like with a drive through line wrapped around the building while the employees turn customers away at the door..Mind you they are standing in there dancing around plus more. Oh not to mention the drug transaction that we just witnessed from an employee to a customer.. SMH SMH

name: Zipperand Stitch
text: Food is good, but I really wish dine is was open. The drive thru line is always so long.

name: Chris Clark
text: Food is pretty good but if I order 30 minutes in advance via the app for pickup I shouldn't be pulled around to wait for them to bring it out to me after spending 15 minutes in the drive thru.

name: Marcus Perry
text: Lobby closed ! Drive thru only. Shell tasted old

name: Aretha Sellers
text: Food was literally thrown together. The taco looked like it had been bitten off. This was not a good experience for a fresh opening. I'm very disappointed.

name: MADE BY CHANTELE
text: Every experience so far has been good.

name: Thomas Landers
text: One of the best Taco Bell’s I have been too. Hopefully they keep it up after the “new Taco Bell smell” fades.

name: M.G. Sturm
text: Tried get breakfast this Saturday, no one answered the drive thru. Emplyees sitting outside told us they would be open at 830am arpund  a little bit

name: Duane Anders
text: Employees do not even know when they open, was told two different times, says 7 doesn’t open until 9.

name: Austin Ya
text: I'm a little Susy baka pog

name: Shaun Powell
text: Left out half our order, won't answer phone, inside is closed so you cant go in. Food we did get was barely cooked.

name: Deborah pellem
text: This is a new one and it's close to home!❤️❤️

name: Marsha
text: Order was not accurate☹

name: Brad “Fly High” Carter
text: Incredibly slow service... Sat at the speaker for almost 10 minutes with a line of cars to the road behind us before our order was ever taken with absolutely no one in front of us. Not to mention the maybe 15 minutes we sat in line before the speaker with only 3 cars ahead of us. Finally get our food, 2 quesadillas, 2 burritos and a taco. Well they got the order right but the quesadillas where literally wadded up in the bottom of the bag..... needless to say we'll stick to the one on 72..

name: Brandy Latham
text: I just got a hard taco and small nachos.... my husband a hard and soft taco both. The hard tacos was so soggy they literally fell apart while eating and I have never seen the meat look like that!

name: T L
text:
I absolutely love Taco Bell and have been going to the ones in Decatur and Florence for years. Last night though, I stopped at the one on Memorial Parkway around 10 pm.

At 7 am today and all day today I am so beyond sick. Something in their food destroyed my stomach (I know it’s Taco Bell, but I’ve never had trouble keeping the food down.)

Something isn’t right about this Taco Bell. Go to a different one.

name: Brad Miller
text: It's Taco Bell. They did get one of the items in my mobile order wrong.  Would have given them 2 stars.  But Asst Mgr gave me the correct item (loaded nacho fries, which were surprisingly good) and threw in order of the cinnamon crisps (puffed fried packing peanuts?).

name: Angela Olivares
text: usually i really do like this place. nice employees and food is always correct. but recently around the same time every night they say they’re system is down and they can’t make food? but employees are sitting outside smoking cigarettes just chilling? if y’all can’t do anything then why are y’all “open”. i work fast food i know how it works. how can y’all afford 5 employees in labor and not making any money? just doesn’t make sense. go home instead of sitting in the clock doing nothing claiming “system is down” so y’all can’t make food. okay. this is a brand new store, y’all should have just kept the old one up.

name: Tom Parker
text: This taco bell is a JOKE! I just went there to get a replacement for an order that they couldn't get right the fist time. As soon as I arrived and told the lady at the box who I was and what I was there for, I got massive attitude. I could not believe the way I was treated! Hey taco bell...don't be mad at me if you can't do your job right the first time. I have NEVER been anything like that with you....I'm a single man who works local. I spend upwards of $200 a month at this store! (Infact just got a $54 work lunch from them YESTERDAY) I hope you've enjoyed my money because I promise you'll get NO MORE. Good day.

name: Deonna Tucker
text: I work here. Love the new building.

name: Erin Conn
text: I have been to this location 4 times total. I have NEVER received a correct order. The most painful thing about that is that the only thing I order “off menu” is extra cheese. Today, I ordered 2 bean burritos and 2 hard shell tacos, all with extra cheese. What I received was 2 beef burritos with nacho cheese and 2 soft tacos without any cheese at all. WILL NEVER REVISIT THIS LOCATION.

name: Curtis Lindsay
text:
I've had good service here and the food has been up to snuff.

One night recently, though, I was given two packs of sauce for a large-ish ($20) drivethru order. When I pulled back through and politely asked for more sauce, the bespectacled red-headed young lady expediting for the window made a sickly exaggerated smirk at me and then tossed an armful of sauce packs into a bag. The young man at the window then handed the bag to me with an amused grin and without comment. There were 54 packs -- I counted them later out of curiosity. I'll never visit this location again.

name: alex B
text: If you're coming from downtown going Southside, stop at the taco bell on airport road. In the last 3 weeks, I've gotten the wrong order, I've been asked to pull around front to wait for 20 minutes for my order, and I've been told that their system was down 3 times. I don't know if it's management or what, but this location is terribly unreliable and it's safer to go somewhere else on your way home.

name: Tori Boles
text: they won’t take 4 orders at the window. but they want you to circle around 4 times, what sense does that make.

name: Robert Ryder
text: New restaurant and quite amazing

name: Holden Kendrick
text: They have a brand new restaurant And they still can't stay open their posted business hours. I just went through the drive thru at around 2:30 and I was told they were closed, and I say again, they have a brand new building.....and they still cannot stay open their posted business hours. This must be the trend at this location, old building and new.

name: James S
text: It's taco bell... Not much else to say.

name: Michael Alexander
text: Served was bad and didn’t even give us the right food

name: Shelly Sanders
text: Poor location, poor employees!!

name: Kian vampire
text: Service is Great

name: kevin harvey
text: Great service

name: Levi Davis
text: This Taco Bell looked amazing. It was so clean. I am eating vegan and have to mod all the options and they hit it on the head with my meal. The staff was very professional and personal. They greeted me with a smile, and joyfully said have a great day as I left! This was an awesome experience.

name: Livvy
text:
The people at the drive through window have always been lovely.
The food however is the reason I'm giving one star. The Chicken Quesadilla is what I typically order and it is barely filled with anything. The ends are typically just tortilla, and 50% of the time there is no sauce. Just chicken and hardly melted cheese.
This picture is from my most recent order. Both of my Quesadillas were filled like this.

name: Vapor
text: 9:15 pm July 20 2021 who ever made my stuff keep it up literally the best Taco Bell I have had in my life!

name: Betty Patterson
text: This Taco Bell needs to get it together. I ordered 2 taco supreme and a quesadilla combo and had to pull up along with the other 5 cars they had pulled up

name: Kirk Martin
text: First thing, the $5 Grande Crunchwrap promotion, real bust because they’re “out of crunchwraps”. Second, there’s a total of 7 vehicles parked and waiting on food from the drive-thru.

name: William Pollock
text:
Sign says breakfast and they don’t have breakfast. Why even bother opening in the morning?

Discontinued about 2 months ago? Even though you just opened?

Either remove the sign or serve breakfast. Either will make me happy and I’ll be willing to order some food to give a better review. The people SEEM relatively nice and the location SEEMS clean but I won’t know until they stop with the false advertising.

name: Christopher Jackson
text: Complete fail. First off they can't make the order correctly. Asked for an order and make with just meat and cheese, and they screwed that up. Also the sweet tea IS GARBAGE, brown water, no tea flavor, no sugar. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY. AND THEY THINK THEY DESERVE $15 PER HOUR. SMH

name: Amanda Davis
text: If you guys are going to have on your website that  you're open tii 11 o'clock,, don't close at 9😒

name: Elliott Smith
text: This taco bell is so poorly managed that they never have featured items in stock. There's no point in even having this location. Just go to a different one.

name: Michael Hooker
text: Waited in line at the drive thru for 20+ mins. When the lady spoke, it was hard to hear her. I asked her to speak up, it didnt help. I began my order then after I mentioned the first item she asked me to hang on. 5 mins later, still hadn't come back on the speaker. Went inside, used the kiosk, still standing here waiting over 20 more mins for the food. They just locked the doors at 10pm yet are supposed to be open till midnight. Told people walking up that they are closed.

name: melanie vinson
text: They have never gotten my order right! It doesn't matter what I order, something will be left off, mixed up, or doesn't make it to the bag. Now, they don't make fries anymore?? I guess I'll go to Prattville for fries, at least I know they won't forget the cheese.

name: Mercy Andrews
text: Rarely have what I want to order. Didn't have breakfast, usually don't have the doritos tacos...Tried getting the potatoe tacos tonight because they are really good and they gave me potatoe bowls 🤷‍♀️. Zelda road location gets mainly all our business.

name: Jasmine Perry
text: Food is never fresh! Day or night; I’ve eaten there over 5 times within the past 6 months and each time I was disappointed. Fast is not cheap. The staff is pretty nice and friendly but corporate needs to step in for quality control and really focus on training  the cooks. The food should be severed fresh regardless of the fact of it being fast food. No one should have to pay for food that’s has been sitting under a warmer too long. Every time I have ordered a chalupa it was hard as a brick and I didn’t even feel like disputing it. The ONLY chalupa that I have eaten, “that was actually fresh”, was the chicken bacon ranch chalupa that was there for a limited amount of time and they had no choice but to make it fresh because it probably wasn’t at high demand. I’ll probably never eat there again now that I have made this post, but something needs to be done. Work ethics and training needs to be reevaluated. Workers should take pride in what they do even if it’s making fast food!

name: Ryan Schluter
text: Drive thru is extremely slow, continuously have lobby closed, sign says breakfast but was told they don't serve breakfast,

name: Vik Lawry
text: They have doors closed to inside. And lone always long. Takes for ever to get food. Plus food I've got last time was soggy and it didn't taste good at all.

name: CRL Motorsports
text: 930 am . Door says Open, Google says open.. Employees inside.. But Naaaa Not open.

name: matthew bailey
text: I was coming to write a bad review after I went through the drive-thru and the girl with the purple hair didn't speak a single WORD to me, but the fact that this place has a two star total review speaks for itself. I drove up and said "hey" and she just stared at me and handed me my drink, closed the window, and came back with my food and shut the window again. Did not speak to me at all. This place needs some serious help and a change in management.

name: austin laboda
text: Terrible service made me wait a while before taking my order they were purposley slowing down the line to try and make it look like they jave good times then they parked us and were so confused they still tried to hand our food thru the drive thru also forgot our potatoes and then they didnt even give me a reciept so i cant do a survey i used to work for yall a couple of years ago and know miss rudolph wouldnt be happy with yall service to bad yall womt hire me back

name: Brandon Richardson
text: Wife ordered some food for us and the kids. My son who does not like beef we substituted for 3 chicken soft tacos, with so much food to check we didn’t. Than we Realized that all tacos were beef. This is just like McDonald’s were they always forget the ranch cups in kids meals. At least Chick-fil-A u can trust it’s always correct. Please step up your game taco bell

name: Ronnie Rasnek
text: So slow I sat in the drive thru 25 min one night and have been in line 15 or more right now...slowest drive thru in millbrook

name: Lunar Hare
text:
This experience has broken me from eating at Taco Bell. The food has become overpriced, my order was missing a quesidilla and the kiosk was lacking options.

The only saving grace is the sweet lady whom was nice enough to help me navigate through and get me 2 dragonflies drinks instead of 2 wild strawberry. To her I say a most sincere Thank You.

name: Luke Pollock
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. 1 employee that works the morning shift basically refuses to serve breakfast, even though it literally says breakfast on the sign. If the manager reads this, please talk to whoever works mornings on Monday because they refuse to put up the breakfast menu. I have been served breakfast by different employees, just don't even bother going if it's before 8, the employee is lazy and basically refuses to do her job.

name: Vvv Mm
text: Ordered a delivery order and they called me and told me the only thing they could give me out of the 5 things I ordered was only the drink. Lol

name: kap kim
text: I went there this past weekend, and it was filled with cars waiting for their food. I considered turning around, but I actually got through the line fairly quickly. I appreciate the staff's professional service. I parked and my food came out a few minutes later. I saw the staff inside and know that they should have had twice the number they had when you consider how busy they were. They did a great job under those circumstances. I think we all forget in these times that we all must understand that things shouldn't always be given to us immediately.

name: Sierra Sapp
text: You know how every town has a terrible Taco Bell? Well, this is this town's one. And they haven't even been open a whole year yet.

name: ⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻⸻
text:
Giving a 1 star review based on one poor visit seems kinda lame tbh. I've been coming to this location very frequently during my lunch breaks and it's been nothing but great every single time. The absolute worst I've experienced is one visit where the food was a little cold, but I've had that at other locales as well, plus my overall experience easily consumes that.

I'd 100% recommend this Taco Bell to anyone.

name: Jasmine Williams
text: I’m not from here and It was 11:25 when I made it and they was already closed but they suppose to close at 12:00am. That won’t right at all. And it also was other people in line also trying to get food but couldn’t just as well as me. Bad view.

name: James Hines
text: It took for ever to get around the building at the drive-through. The parking lot is set up so you are pretty much trapped  by the drive-through traffic If you have to park. So when you get to the drive-through they take your order and make you drive all  the way around the building to park and bring your food to you but now you are trapped in the same drive-through line that you just waited in for ever on your food  to get out of the parking lot. They should not make you go park when you are at the drive-through window you should wait on your food so you don't have to be trapped for 30 minutes in cars. This does not make sense and I won't be going back To get in that situation again. To make matters worse I barely parked when they brought me the food so making me move and park because it took an extra 2 minutes cost me 15 minutes trying to get out.  Bad design on making people park .

name: KidwitA Camera
text: The service is horrible and slow every time I visit this store !! the manager chelsey doesn’t know how to run a business !!

name: Edwin Chavez
text: I went in through the drive thru today June 11 of 2021 and the workers that were working around 8:30 got my order wrong 4 time and they refused to give me sauces even after they made me pay extra and there was two young girls being very rude after they made me pull up to the curbside I do not recommend at all very poor service and very unprofessional workers.

name: ZoGotDatDo
text: I ordered some fries from Doordash. I got my order & came across something brown in the fries. It looks like ground beef, but you can tell it’s not. I’m not sure what it is.

name: Kevin Johnson
text: Went inside at 7:30pm and ordered with my sister and her husband in line behind me. They were told that no more orders would be taken that they would have to go through the drive through. Also was missing some food. Whoever is managing night shift needs to go. The i don’t care attitude is disrespectful and annoying. If the lobby is going to be closing there needs to be a sign stating what time.

name: L D (strong women)
text: I didn’t get my change back!. I was shorted by almost a quarter and the girl popped an attitude at my first question! I don’t need this bs! You don’t either! Just go down the road about 3 miles to the next Taco Bell they are way better!!!!

name: Amanda Mitchell
text: Went there tonight and won't be going back. Got cold fries and flattened tacos that were severely lacking in everything except for broke shell. Horrible experience. Would give them no star if possible

name: Kasey Scott
text: Millbrook Taco Bell, they did good when they first opened however seems like they lack leadership. Went there tonight and their drive thru process couldn’t have been more thoughtless. I ordered my small order and was asked to pull forward into a parking spot. That wasn’t the problem, the problem was it took almost 30 minutes for them to even find what car I was in because they took no measures in finding out who these orders belong to at the window. NO SYSTEM AT ALL! If there is a manager there they need to be trained better. Not to mention my daughters order only had a few thrown in chips for nachos, I order a side of sour cream that was literally a teaspoon size amount, and my quesadilla had the wrong sauce and was burnt. TAKE POINTERS FROM CHIK-fil-A please!!!!

name: anm1980
text: I don’t like this Taco Bell anymore terrible customer service

name: Richard Boyer
text: What a disappointment!  The nachos box thing was terrible.  My wife’s had a whole five small pieces of chicken on it which we had to pay extra for.  There probably less diced tomatoes on them then on a taco. The chips tasted stale and we did not get the mid taco sauce we ordered.  Guess I will not be going back there and will drive to another location if I want Taco Bell.  Also, some days the line for the drive up is in the parking lot where it belongs and some nights it is all the way up the road instead which blocks the urgent care office along that road.

name: Rebecca Rolling
text:
Food was good..service was excellent but after the sweet girl repeated it back 3 times to me... they still had lettuce on em! Lol
She can only tell the food servers

name: Matthew Wood
text: The service is terrible they took 10 minutes to make my order we we were the only ones there and they still got my order wrong so they went back to make it again and 15 minutes later they still get it wrong never go to this Taco bell

name: Tina Dandridge
text: Went through the drive thru the employees  were  nice but everything we ordered had hardly any meat . It was like all of my order was half there.

name: Quentonic
text: The reviews here were removed once before I'm guessing to remove the negative review i left, but one of your employees is very rude and very unprofessional, they didn't give what we ordered and they also told us we were wrong and that the food we ordered was in there when it wasnt and then tried to sneak our food in when we handed them the bag and told us it was in there already. Unacceptable behavior.

name: Jennifer Boggs
text: Terrible place!! Employees are rude and get the order wrong, then when you ask for it to be corrected they act like your were the one who is wrong. So much for enjoying taco bell close to home.

name: Antoine Green
text: I guess they just close down when they feel like it...It’s 8 p.m on a Thursday they already closed.....smh

name: Joseph minor
text: Great food, friendly service

name: Amanda Frost
text: My chalupa was hard as a rock it was so old and my chicken inside it was cold

name: James Allen
text: Very good

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Why don't they serve breakfast? Why in the world would THIS location close at 8pm daily? And when did this start? This location is one of the WORST!

name: Bro AJ
text: Great service

name: Randy Owens
text: Place has gone to trash

name: Amanda Kelsey
text: I went through the drive through. The person working that area was very pleasant. She made sure she heard my order correctly. She was very easy to understand what she was saying through the speaker.  My order was ready fast and it was correct.

name: Tray Rasco
text:
Just pulled in and out of the drive through again. Apparently they have discontinued the Mexican pizza. The Mexican pizza was one of the only things in the menu unique to the chain. Everything else is better at a sit down Mexican restaurant. Now my decision to eat here will only be for quick food when I can not sit down at a restaurant.  This decision will cut my visits to Taco Bell by 70%. I use to go to Taco Bell 3+ times a week. Thank god for the party pack nachos, while they last. For today my money went to Jacks :(

I can only imagine someone did not do a proper cost benefit analysis on this decision. While it may look like they lost out in a Mexican pizza sale. In reality the Mexican pizza was my reason for stoping at Taco Bell. This was the unique item I could not get anywhere else. Once I was at the window for a Mexican pizza I would then add on the other 6-7 dollars Of menu items. I definitely do not crave an over priced taco or a burrito that has all beans..

resp.text: We are very sorry about this! Come back to visit us and we will gladly remake you a new meal!

name: Hombre Lobo (Wolfman)
text: The out door searing was great but there was a funny taste to my cinnamon twist

name: Yologsolive Kennedy
text: Went there to get something to eat after the tornados that ripped through our town no lights so we couldn’t cook they were great they treated everyone like they were special they were working hard to keep everybody’s order straight even though they were short staffed. I waited in line but it was worth ever minute it was hot and delicious. Thank you guys you were great!!!!!

text:
Some days it is excellent. Others your order is wrong or there is about half the food in the shell/wrap that corporate says there should be. Some days they wear masks, others they don't. Other days employees smoke next to the drive through line.

Its the roll of the dice any particular day what will happen when you visit. Be prepared to check your food before pulling away. And 99% of the time you have to ask for a receipt...which would be only a minor annoyance if they didn't act like you were asking them for super special treatment for such a simple thing that should be standard anyway.

resp.text: We are very sorry about this! At this time our receipt machine was down but we have that fixed! Thank you for your feedback!

name: Autumn Smith
text: I had a complicated order on my end. Everyone wanted food special and bagged separate. Man named Kip was taking orders. He made sure things were in line for me. All food was perfect. Thank you all TB employees. You all made it work.

name: Tim Beasley
text: Awesome new taco grill in town.  Great and convenient location.  Huge portions, way better than any typical taco served anywhere I've ever been.  Excellent taco variety (fish, shrimp, port, steak, chicken).  Really cool atmosphere with inside and outside seating.  Great live music.  This will definitely be a regular occurrence on my dining outings.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Mr Tim. It has been our pleasure serving you and your family!

name: Rhonda Griffin
text: I am thoroughly delighted with the quality and flavor of these tacos.  Being from Texas, I found good tacos like the ones I grew up on, hard to find in Birmingham.  Not anymore!! Texas Taco Grill is my go to when I am longing for that taste of home.  Amazing quality of grilled steak, chicken and fish with OUTSTANDING flavor...Mmmm yummy! Nice atmosphere.....Clean, friendly and inviting.  They have a great outdoor patio with live music on the weekends... Promise, you won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your flattering and encouraging review! Moving forward, we aim to make this a frequent stop for some of the best local musical talent around. We look forward to serving you again!

name: lockswim
text: I saw that this place finally opened so I decided to try it out , hoping a great new restaurant had opened up right near my house. I was disappointed. The cashier and girl running tables were both pretty rude, as well as the guy cleaning tables afterwards. I had questions about the menu but the cashier gave me short abrupt answers and seemed like it was annoying her that I was asking her about the food. I had 2 of the tacos with steak and chips and salsa. I will say that the portions were pretty large, especially for a taco. They don't skimp on toppings, but the taste of them left a lot to be desired. They were both mediocre, so if you feel like having tacos just go to a true Mexican restaurant, they will be better there. Apparently, their salsa is supposed to be really something special, but it just tasted like average restaurant salsa to me, there didn't seem to be anything about it that stood out. All in all, I don't regret going so that I now know what it is like, but I won't be returning.

resp.text: I am truly sorry that we fell short of your expectations. It is our goal to offer all of our customers the best product and overall experience that we can. I would be very interested in learning more about your experience. It will enable me to use the information to implement measures for improvement. Feel free to call 205-203-0506 and ask for me. Max / General Manager

name: Eric Hollis
text: Great Tacos! Very well priced and worth a lot more that what you have to pay. Very good Guacamole too. Definitely need to try it, cool little place.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Mr Eric! It's always a pleasure serving you!

name: James Allen
text: I had hoped to give this new Taco place a 4 or 5 star rating after going there for the 1st time last week.  However, the "I couldn't care less about you being here" attitude my wife & I got from the young lady who took our order,  two stars is the best I can provide at this time.  This young woman not only had this unfriendly, unprofessional attitude the night my wife & I were there last week, she treated my wife & her friend even worse when they went there for lunch a day earlier.  Perhaps this young lady is from somewhere where such rude service is the norm.  But, here in the South, most of us were raised to be courteous & respectful towards one another in all of our encounters - this is especially true when we go somewhere to eat!  I sincerely hope that the owners will address this matter quickly as I would really like to see this new business succeed.

name: Rory Doyle
text: The Food was great!  Large portions perfect price point.  The live music really made it a feel good environment.

resp.text: Thank you Rory! We will be featuring local music artists every Friday and Saturday night in the near future.

name: Kassady Gibson
text:
I asked the lady ringing me up what was the best way to order and how large were the tacos. She said I should start with the menu.

I ordered 3 different tacos and some chips and salsa (for 2 people). The same lady said, well...aren't you covering your bases.

I can't have gluten so I ordered tacos with corn tortillas. I got all flour.

The salsa is not good.

resp.text:
Hi Kassady, thank you for visiting us. We regret that your experience with us failed to meet your expectations. We are very proud of our house made, award winning salsas. We would love to talk to you directly about your experience. Feel free to contact us at contact@texastaco.com or call us at 205-203-0506
Thanks!

name: Jessica Farmer
text: I'm very picky when it comes to Mexican because I've had so many different varieties. This place is awesome. I ordered the cross road which is grilled chicken. It was seasoned well and paired with bell peppers, onions, pick de gallo and cheese. I took one bite and was extremely happy. I also ordered the guacamole which is hard to make well. They do a great job and the chips tasted fresh. All of the food was fresh and cooked well. I will have this as one of my new places to eat.

name: Robert Evans
text: Good food and very nice people but very plain looking inside and there was not much of a selection.  Lots of tacos of course but  even with a big list of names the ingredients were so similar that there was really only a few choices.  Has a lot of potential.  I will try again and hopefully will be surprised and I can upgrade my rating.

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback Robert, and thank you for your patronage!
We are in the ongoing process of decorating. It should be complete before too long.
We currently have 9 different gourmet tacos in our offering. We will be adding 4 additional tacos and a few more menu items on our next menu revision.
We look forward to serving you again!

name: Kyle Davis
text: Really good.  Food is fresh, cooked to order. Large portions, reasonable prices.  Will be coming back.

resp.text: Thank you for your encouraging review Kyle!

name: Sarah Potter
text: We asked Texas Taco to cater an event for 50 and they knocked it out of the park. Service and food were fantastic! They even made a special trip back to deliver one guy gluten free tacos.

resp.text: Thank you for the encouraging review Sarah! It was such a pleasure serving all of you! Thank you so much for your business... looking forward to serving you again!

name: J C
text: Very slow and expensive for what you get.  The tacos were good but not great.  The queso was fair at best.  The positive is the the staff if trying and seems friendly.  I hope they can pull it together.

name: Stephanie Mcilvaine
text: Went for lunch should have known something was up when we entered at noon and only two customers there. Food is horribly overpriced and not good. One taco is $5 and chips and salsa are extra. For me and my son $35!! As we waited for our food, 4 people came in perused the menu and left.. keep on driving to taco mama or something similar.

name: Scott Phillips
text: INCREDIBLE freshness & flavor.  Very casual with excellent service.  I had the Magic City (smoked pork) & the Cowtown (smoked brisket).  Excellent & plentiful fresh ingredients in a grilled flour tortilla, which really brought out the flavor.  My wife raved over the Tree Hugger (veggies) & queso cheese dip & fresh guacamole -- tops in the area & definitely our "go-to" spot for the best Tex-Mex from now on!

resp.text: Thank you for your very encouraging review Mr Scott! It's been our joy to serve you and your family.

name: Joe Schillaci
text: Good prices and tasty beef taco.  only one complaint.  They need to give you at least twice the queso and salsa.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Joe... we are so glad you enjoyed the food! Just so you know, we offer a small and a large in our queso, guac, and salsa. The large size is a healthy 8 ozs. Please be sure to specify large when ordering. If not, the system defaults to a small. We look forward to serving you again!

text: Delicious food, great atmosphere and overall wonderful experience. I will definitely go back and I will refer to others.

resp.text: Thank you for your review... We are so glad you enjoyed your experience with us!

text: Best Guacamole I've had in Years!!! It was fresh and simple. The avocado was not outshined by A multitude of ingredients. Thanks Michel Le for taking me! This is definitley5 one of my favorites  spots.

resp.text: Thank you Melanie for trying us out... we are very pleased that you enjoyed your experience with us!

text: These guys honestly make the best tacos I have ever put in my mouth! Top notch service and top notch food!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us Chase! We enjoyed serving you.

name: Dillon
text: Wasn't too impressed with the tacos for the price. Definitely not bad though.

name: McKinnon “Mac” Maddox
text: Well done Texas Taco! I’m a taco enthusiast, and these tacos are made to perfection. Huge portions. Very high quality meats. Chicken, shrimp, prime beef, catfish, mahi, salmon, pork, top sirloin. My favorite was the cat daddy (fried catfish) with a creamy jalapeño sauce. Wow!! I also loved the Rosita Ranch (top sirloin) with the grilled onions and feta. The tacos are the perfect size and I just want to eat them all the time. Their chips and queso is seriously the best I’ve ever had. Fast and friendly service too. My tacos were on the table when I returned from the drink machine. Great place for friends and family. It has such a fun atmosphere and feels like you’re at the beach! Big patio outside with string lights, music, and nice view of sunset. Awesome hangout spot for me and my friends after work. The food speaks for itself. So glad we have this in Vestavia!

resp.text: Thank you for your review Mr McKinnon! We are in business to provide our customers an experience like yours. We are so happy you enjoyed it! We look forward to serving you again!

name: Lisa
text: You must go here if you're in the Birmingham area. I love tacos in general but these tacos are next level! They are LOADED! The cat daddy and the magic city are so tasty. Flavorful, cooked perfectly, with the right amount of kick. QUESO - GET THIS! Best chips and queso I have found. Chips are crisp and you dip into the queso so they don't get soggy. Atmosphere is great. So much fun with the lights and big patio! Feels like you're on vacation! Must-eat place!!

resp.text: Thank you for your very encouraging review Lisa! We are so glad you enjoy our product. It is always our pleasure to serve you!

name: Nicholas Blackstock
text:
My experience here was VERY mediocre at VERY best!

Sad to say but I just didn't care for this place at all. Granted it was only one review, but obviously... first impressions have weight in the Yelp community! We got the two taco for $10 lunch special or whatever it was... Meh! Neither was warm or tasty. The chips that came with the salsa were good tho lol.

Atmosphere inside (during a weekday lunchtime) wasn't very busy, was kinda dark, and all of the staff seemed to be trying to work out the kinks of being a newer establishment still. Nobody really seemed to know what was going on; miscommunications between kitchen, servers and cashier alike. The whole vibe was just kinda awkward.

I see some good reviews out there... more power to you all, my experience wasn't worthy of such.

resp.text: Thanks for trying us out Nick. We are sorry you just had an ok experience. We are continually tweaking our processes and procedures with the goal of improving our product and overall experience. We hope you try us again!

name: SAVISALES NET
text: Great new place service was quick food was delicious the live music was good to

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review!

text: Fresh. Quick. Tasty. What more could you want?

resp.text: Thank you for your business, and your review Jeremy... it was our pleasure serving you!

name: Daniel Benson
text: Food is great, comes out fast, and the lunch special is a great deal!

resp.text: Thank you Daniel... we appreciate your support!!!

name: J T
text: We were not very impressed and thought the food was overpriced. I expect a taco to be single hand friendly and these are packed and all of the overflow just falls over the top. The beef and pork I tried were very good but I don't want to have to wrangle a taco like it is a Subway sandwich and at $5 a taco, it is just too much. Most of the menu is a la carte so if you want chips and salsa or cheese dip, it is extra. The kids plates include salsa or cheese dip but not the tacos. You can get flour or corn tortillas. I had flour and they were of the store bought variety which is fine but for the price I expected more. The restaurant itself looks unfinished, the walls are bare and not decorated. There is a TV but it was not on. Our clerk was obviously new and with a trainer but neither of them could figure out how to get the register open to get my change so I just told them to keep it. While getting our drinks I overheard an employee talking to an owner or manager about a problem with another employee. I thought is was pretty unprofessional. This kind of thing should not be happening around customers. All in all, the meal was ok but I can't see us going back. They have only been open for a short time and hopefully things will get better.

name: John Lentz
text: Overpriced, little food, and terrible atmosphere

name: Michel Le
text: Forget everything you know about tacos. This place redefines what taco should taste. They are delicious, and the best is that they are under $5!!  Those guys, Max (owner) and Dennis (chef) come from Texas, so they are true connoisseurs. My favorite is the shrimpy one. Deeeelicious! The shrimps are huge and cooked to perfection. I also loved the cowtow taco, with its big chunks of prime beef (not grounded beef). The place itself is very inviting, kinda modern/rustic. There is a BIG terrace with lots of chairs, sofas (patio kind) and tables. It just need a fireplace, wi-fi and voila! Can't wait for this summer to eat outside. Oh and the staff is top notch, efficient and smily =). This will definitively a must hang-out place for me.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Michel! It's always a pleasure serving you.

name: Anna T
text: I came in this place wanting to like it especially hearing people were comparing it to Torchy's Tacos in Texas which I love. I was sadly disappointed. I ordered two tacos and the queso. The queso was ok but did not seem homemade and the mediocre chips were not warm. Only two choices of salsa - medium or hot - and the medium is definitely medium and not mild which makes one question why there isn't a mild option. The seasoning on the meat was non existent and the cheese sprinkled on top seemed like it was kraft taco shredded cheese purchased from the publix across the street. Why not serve Mexican cheese?? It seems all the tacos come with grilled peppers and grilled onions making the menu items lacking any innovation. Just google Torchys Tacos and read the descriptions of theirs, and compare it to the unexciting tacos at this place. If you think this place has the best tacos or best queso, you have never been to El Barrio or even Taco Mama or even the La Cantina food truck. Overall these were tacos I could have made at home except mine would have been better and this place needs to rethink its tacos to be more tasty and more exciting. Definitely does not deserve the word "gourmet" in its name.

text: Great tacos just not very large portions.

text: I can understand if you are understaffed but when your location says open until 1 and it’s 11:30 and someone is waiting at the drive thru how about have some customer service and say I’m sorry we are closed.........  not just look at them and go about your day. Zero stars for plain lazy employees. I’m sure the owner of this location is unaware you are closing 2 hours before you are suppose to. Your google page was just updated with this new time.

text: I eat here all the time, but with the expectation that they will get something wrong or I'll have terrible service, or if I'm feeling extra lucky, both. Other than those, if you adjust your expectations, you won't be let down.

text: After waiting a whole year I found out this location has gotten 10x worse I went to purchase food today from this location when I got home and looked at the food it looked horrible the taco was soggy and the quesadilla was burnt and to add on they got my two supreme tacos wrong and when I went to return them after biting half of one and realizing it wasn’t what I paid for the lady asked for the food back which was a big NO NO with COVID-19 and other viruses you should never receive food that has been in someone else’s possession and I witnessed other employees opening the food which I had took bites out of and still preparing food (CROSS-CONTAMINATION!!) The employee and manager refused to give me two supreme tacos because one had been bitten out of and I got shorted my money because she did not give me the taco I had took a bite out of and after I received the replacement I did not feel like eating it because of the cross-contamination. This is a breeding ground for all types of illnesses the window they are serving out of has dirt piled on it and finger smudges and from what I’m told this is nothing new. Every single one of the afternoon shift employees (and managers) need to get retrained on their customer service skills and cross-contamination.

resp.text: That's not okay, Melissa. We want to know more. Please DM us on Twitter @TacoBellCare.

After a few secs, someone found it funny to tell me that a bird only comes with 2 wings, 2 legs, 2 thighs, and a breast!!!! I hadn't paid for anything this time. I told them that was incorrect and they took the food back from my car window and HAD TO ORDER AGAIN. Then, when I FINALLY got home....MY FOOD WAS BARELY WRAPPED AND WAS DUMPED OUT OF THE SHELLS AND DIRECTLY INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE BAG. The employees here are a disgrace and it's amazing that they were even able to land a job in the first place. It's really a sad thing to see.

Especially when I have to go all the way back to get my order corrected and the girl up front could tell I was irritated, but when she has to ask if the food was done yet, and the girl who was making it gets sassy and tells back that shes making it makes it worse. Cause all I wanted was to go home and eat a quick meal with my fiance  and when I finally get back my food was cold, so I decided I just wasnt going to eat. Like I said I hate leaving negative reviews, but this isn't the first time something like this has happened at this Taco Bell!

text: The past two times I have been, the meximelts have been PITIFUL. Very tiny. Hardly anything on the inside. & those are like $2.59 a piece plus tax. Y’all UPCHARGED me for the steak, when it was all y’all had. Went last night, spent $18 on a small  drink, large drink, 4 meximelts, 2 cheese rollups, & 4 pack of cinnabons. Y’all were slow, & out of the cinnabons. She asked if i wanted twists or an empanada instead.. which is cheaper. She told me to have a good night & was about to let me drive off having paid extra! I’m NOT happy about paying nearly $3 a piece for that pitiful food!

A front entrance door was locked and we saw 2 different customers attempt to come in and left due to thinking it was closed due to the locked door. I told the cashier that they should make a sign for the door stating to use other door and she just laughed. It was nasty so much so our shoes were sticking to the floor. name: Joel Pike
text: I cannot believe the level of problems with my experience. We finally decided to do fast food after over 2 months. I was the only person in line and tried to use the app to order, and the app was down, we called in to make sure we can do drive through. I literally read the order off the app in the drive through very slowly and very carefully. The manager was running the drive through order taking. I spent $29.57 at about 9 pm on 5/17/20. I received half my order, it was cold, some double wrapped in tortillas. 100% not the correct portions, ingredients and not even close to the food I ordered. I left with about $10 worth of cold food. When i called back the response i recieved was to come back for the missing items sometime in the next few days. We took picture to send to the complaint department. Very very disappointing experience

text: Apparently lunch rush hour is the time where they decide that working on their monitors is a great choice. And they are apparently incapable of walking the 10 ft to front counter registers. When we pulled up in the drive thru, they ask us to come inside (during a pandemic). Another logic issue, this drive thru doesn't have a way to pull out. There are 4-5 cars in front of us and 3 behind us. We are stuck. How exactly are we supposed to just come inside? Takes about 10 minutes for the cars to start moving out of the line. Needless to say, we did come in and won't be coming back due to the incompetence and lack of management. P.S. They always run out of Baja Blast at this store consistently so good luck if that is the reason you are stopping by this place. They also skimp out on the chicken in the quesadillas so if you enjoy paying chicken quesadilla prices for a cheese quesadilla then you will love this store.

name: Pasky Pasky
text:
NEVER skip checking your bag(s) after going through the drive through at this location. Your order is guaranteed to be wrong 9 times out of 10, and they will neglect to give you some of the items you paid for. To top that off, the items you managed to receive will likely not be made properly. I can't tell you how many times my grilled chicken quesadilla was steak or shredded chicken (yuck) instead. I've also ordered extra cheese or meat on multiple occasions in the past, only to be given *less* than the normal amount.

To make matters worse, the staff is very slow and extremely rude. They never apologize when they mess up orders; it's pretty obvious they don't care due to their passive attitudes.

Management: Please make sure your employees know that it is not appropriate to not give the customer what they paid for. It's making this location look very bad, especially considering how amazing the Alabaster location is. I don't think I'll bother here anymore.

name: Brian Bannister
text:
This is my favorite place to eat in Alabama. I love the owners and the staff. They have always been first class and served delicious food. The food truck was my first
encounter with this business and I fell in love, not only with the food but the staff and ownership as well. The restaurant is just as good!! Do not hesitate to hit this spot up!!

name: Jackie Turman
text: The food is delicious!  I went on Taco Tuesday.  They have so many options to choose from.  I had the fried cauliflower one along with a southern belle that's chicken and bacon by the way.  I also had a fried shrimp taco which was taco of the day.  I loved each one.  I will be returning to try all of them eventually.  3 tacos and a side dish for a little over $10 bucks you can't beat that!  There are lots of other sandwiches and meals on the menu.  I recommend this spot to expand your taste buds. Great staff and great food! Brisket, Pulled Pork and mahi mahi here I come!

name: Jessica Yurkin
text: Food was delicious! Both vegan and non vegan options were so yummy. The staff was nice, good atmosphere, and food came out quick. Definitely recommend stopping here!

name: John Muhlhauser
text: The customer service is top notch.  Very accommodating! There tacos are Instagram worthy! They do a great job at maximizing the amount of food per taco ratio.  However I only give 4 stars, I felt like the food was a but bland. When I look at these amazing looking tacos I expected a burst of flavors, but they all just mashed together.  Other than that not a bad little place.

name: Jeri Remley
text: We loved this resturant! The food is great and the service was outstanding. As far as social distancing, they offer outdoor seating although no heaters for chilly evening. The tables inside are spaced appropriately and they leave the door open to allow fresh air to circulate. Try the brisket...so good👍

name: Hunter Holland Medders
text: We booked the Fire & Spice Food Truck for our wedding and it was a major success! We are STILL getting compliments from guests on how amazing the tacos were! Thomas and LeAndra are so cool and easy-going and rolled with all the punches when we had to postpone our wedding and move to a new venue. We always wanted a food truck at our wedding and Fire & Spice exceeded all expectations. The tacos came out quickly for all of our guests and no one left hungry! Seriously, one of our favorite parts of our wedding was having Fire & Spice there. If you’re considering booking them, we cannot recommend them enough!

name: Daymis Kimbrough
text: Best tacos in town!! The BBQ is pretty awesome too. You can't go wrong with this place if you like Tex- Mex.

name: Andrew Tykol
text: I used to live in Texas and grew to love Tex-Mex (especially Torchy's Tacos). Fire and Spice totally nails it and is the only place in the Huntsville/Madison area that offers Tex-Mex (try the southern bell taco). They have a large variety and I've never had anything I didn't love. They have amazing sides, try the poblano potato salad. Also, did I mention they have amazing BBQ as well? This place is truly amazing. One of my favorite restaurants in the area!

name: Andrew Tykol

name: Blake Malone
text: The place is a great concept. Clean and looks incredible. The food however was just ok. The pulled pork had no flavor. The brisket was decent. The sausage was ok. The chips and Queso tasted warmed up and store bought. The fries were very underwhelming. Solid concept , but for the food quality it is overpriced in my opinion.

name: Nathan Burley
text: Fire & Spice didn't disappoint. The mix of spice and flavors was amazing. I had one of my tacos with smoked sausage. Unbelievably good. My niece and nephew loved their meals, and they can be picky. This is the best taco I ve ever had in my life. The restaurant was warm, friendly, and they are following the Madison county covid mandates.

name: Joe Pierce
text: The best tex mex in the area, hands down. Get the Santa Fe taco, you won't regret it. Brisket is excellent also. This may be one of the best kept secrets in Huntsville but they deserve to be mentioned among the valley's best dining experiences, IMHO.

text:
Grab a seat, this gonna be a long one.  Born and raised in Texas, I know my Tex-Mex-BBQ. If I could give a 4.25 stars, I would.  Being my fist time there, I had the BBQ sampler with potato salad and ff as sides.The sides were perfect.  Flavor was off the chain and the amount given was more than enough, thankfully.  The sampler comes with brisket, pulled pork and sausage.  For the price, I could have used a bit more brisket and a lil less pork but I was completely full at the end of the meal, as I mentioned before the sides were ample.  The flavor was perfect, my only complaint was the brisket was a tad on the dry side, I know brisket is tough to get right fresh off the grill, much less hours or the next day.   I didn't get any desert, I asked where the pecan pie came from and was a lil disappointed to learn is was from Sam's rather freshly made, especially at $6.00 a slice.  My wife had the Southern Bell and Brisket tip Tacos and she said they were amazing.  To finish up, I'll definitely go back, the atmosphere was great and the staff was amazing.

UPDATE: I went back this past weekend and ordered just a brisket plate and it melted in my mouth.  Full of flavor to the last bite.

name: Amelia Hooper
text: Got takeout for my boyfriend and myself. He really liked his fish tacos. I was impressed by the vegan options! I ordered a vegan quesadilla and while it was good, it was painfully spicy. Like enough to make Fuego Takis cry. My boyfriend didn't like mine at all, but I handled it okay. Good food, but because the menu gave me no indication it would be so hot, I'll be very careful when ordering next time.

text: This was good! I mean really really good. I'll definitely be back!

text: Hands down a go too!! 🔥 You will not be disappointed. A must try 👌

name: Bret Griffin
text: One if the best bbq Tex-Mex places around. If you have'nt tried their food yet then you're missing out. Homemade margaritas with anything on the menu will make your day!

name: Laurie Holbert
text: Food is always fresh and amazing! You may have to wait a little but it's worth it.

name: Nick DiBiasi
text: Food was delicious! Don't let your appetite deceive you, there are items that ARE still hot, so be aware. Definitely a must return spot to try the various items on the menu. Happy hour is from 2p-5p, and drink specials are half off. The Russian Roulette taco is very hot! Try the Mac n' cheese, it's awesome.

name: Kendra Castillo
text:
Working with this establishment has been a total NIGHTMARE. I never leave bad reviews BUT our experience with these people for the past year working with them has been awful! We sat down and spoke with the owners Thomas and Leandra about catering our wedding. We had several encounters afterwards that we got “attitude “ from Leandra. When our wedding got cancelled due to Covid they weren’t originally able to accommodate the rescheduled date and told us that we wouldn’t get a refund. Afterwards they told us again that they could cater our new wedding date so we were relieved despite the several run ins and issues we had.
Well 25 days away from the wedding they asked that I call and go over wedding details and so I did. I had what seemed like a normal call as she explained procedure and I agreed to accommodate all requests including masking our guests and ect. Leandra said she would email over the contract to abide by their covid guidelines. Around 30 minutes after the phone call they emailed us stating that they would be backing out of our wedding.
I am absolutely disgusted by the customer service and integrity that this company has offered us.
We have been pleasant and have paid everything in full. Luckily they are refunding us but hey! 25 DAYS UNTIL OUR WEDDING.
There is a happy ending , we called Hops and Guac and they are more than happy and willing to accommodate our big day.

Horrible business, horrible service and I hate to give even a 1 star on this review because they don’t deserve it.

resp.text: What Kendra failed to mention is that we have never done business with her. She just copied and pasted the review from her friend Jordan. Thank you for bashing a local business because we made the decision to keep our employees safe rather than attend a wedding that will not be up to the health standards.

name: Ralph Cantrell
text:
I'm not sure I can do this place justice with my limited vocabulary and writing skills, but here goes:

This place is truly a Huntsville treasure. It is easily one of the most unique dining experiences in town. The menu is unlike any other, and EVERYTHING is good. This is not fast food, and it isn't priced as such,  but the value is definitely there and I think anyone who tries it will agree. It does come to you fast enough however, and it won't cost you an arm and a leg or anything, just don't expect average, low-rate mexican food prices as that is absolutely not what you will be getting.

The brussel sprouts are to die for. I already liked brussel sprouts, but I've never had any anywhere that are even close to theirs. I can't even begin to describe them, but take my word for it. Even if you think you hate brussel sprouts, you will probably love them. The soft tacos are big and they are lovingly put together and presented "gourmet-style" on a large, metal tray that is then covered with wax paper. They're not just slapped together all haphazard and plopped on a cheap plate like at everywhere else. You can mix and match them for a chance to try several different ones in a visit too. There are lots of different ones to choose from and they all are awesome, with like 6 or 7 different fresh ingredients each and then drizzled with unique spices and sauces. The different meats in each one are not ground or shredded into oblivion, but are thick pieces that need to be bitten into, which is good because you can better appreciate the exceptional taste and texture that comes from the extra care that went into cooking it.

There are also burritos, lots of different sandwiches, and even some more traditional items like BBQ and such. It takes a few minutes to study and understand the menu before you can know exactly which items will be perfect for you personally, but I'm pretty sure it will happen for most everyone just as it did for me.

Well, I tried. Thanks for the great dining experience, Fire & Spice!
f

resp.text: What Jordan failed to mention is that the wedding party did not want to wear face masks and social distance during the wedding, because it would “ruin her pictures”, and that her solution was to have a box of face masks by the food truck if people wanted to wear one to order food. As a business we have the responsibility to make sure both our employees and customers are safe and we follow health orders. We did not feel safe working a wedding that does not care to follow the rules placed upon us, so we backed out of the wedding, sent them a list of potential replacements for caterers and refunded 100% of their money. We feel great about our decision to do so and this review along with all the other ones left proves our point.

name: kye grisham
text: Great Customer Service. I ordered through Grub Hub and the service from Grub Hub was horrible (Not the Restaurant). It was well over an hour and they had not assigned a driver for the order. I was not even aware until the Restaurant called me to let me know that Grub hub was taking too long and wanted to know if I would like to pick up the order or wait for Grub Hub. They were closing in 10 minutes. Although I placed the order an hour before they closed they said they would wait for me. I decided to either let Grub Hub get it or refund me. The restaurant called me 30 minutes later to let me know the driver had picked up the order and was on the way. The entire time Grub Hub would not assist. I finally talked to someone at Grub Hub and requested a refund but only if the Restaurant would not be taking the hit. I called the Restaurant and spoke with Leandra. This was after hours and well after they closed. She answered and was excellent to talk to. Even through it was not their fault she was concerned about the service I had received because of Grub Hub. Needless to say, the Food was excellent and the customer service and true concern from Leandra and the staff was overwhelming. Thank you.

name: Kevin Dover
text: Food was absolutely delicious!!! Probably the best tacos I’ve had in Huntsville.

name: Wendy Shuey
text: OMG OMG OMG best food  I have had since moving here  to Huntsville. I had the Burnin Love. I INHALED it! Literally you could not pry it from my hands. It was fantastic. Will definitely go here again ( often!!!) and definitely recommend for everyone to try it.  Thank you for delivering it to my work place. It was hot and delicious. TY TY TY

text: The food is always fresh and the service is amazing.

name: Shannon Christman
text: My Coworkers and I ordered from here for lunch and it blew us all away!! I have had tacos from the food truck when they were downtown Huntsville about two years ago so I knew it would be good. BUT today, the food was hot and fresh when it was delivered. I made a mistake on our order and called to fix it and they were fantastic about it!! I will definitely be coming more often and supporting this local business!! Thank you for all you are doing during this crazy time. It is VERY much appreciated!!

name: Tonya Baessler
text:
Appearance A+ however the Fiesta Chicken Bowl has been on the decline since I first ordered it two years ago. Not sure why I continue to get the same think knowing it's going to be a disappointment. The chicken taste like it came straight from a boiling pot, the entire bowl was watery. Really strange considering previous visits the meat actually tasted like it was smoked. It was also shredded, usually the fiesta bowl consists of chunks. As usual, nothing is ever as good as the first time right?!

THE OWNER OF THIS COMPANY needs to understand that the reviews are for the customers to REVIEW THEM! I was not late picking up my food, you are sadly mistaken. The quality of your food has gone down hill since you opened IN MY OPINION. I also stated that in recent visits, it was the same as well. You can see/read that with what other people are saying as well. You should respect the opinions of your customers instead of ALWAYS having some smart reply to everyone's review. I'm sorry but it doesn't look good on your part, and it's obviously a pattern.

resp.text: We apologize for your experience. With that being said, you were late by 45 minutes to pick up your order so yes, nothing will be great when it sits in the warmer for 45 minutes. Next time we would love to make it fresh for you, if you are running late all you have to do is call us and let us know and we can work with that.

name: kyle brown
text:
Nothing to write home about.

Atmosphere: This type of business sets itself up for a very fun and attention grabbing atmosphere(like you would see at taco mama or hops & guac) but they fail to do anything interesting with the space inside which makes it feel stale and awkward. There's random classic funk rock like old Zeppelin and cream playing very quietly as a backdrop to the one tv above the bar with a game on. It feels like the restaurant was decorated for something else and halfway through they gave up and turned it into a taco joint. Identity crisis.

Customer service: Not impressed. The cashier or server or whatever he was didn't seem to know much about the menu which is a pretty big deal when your making food as specific as this. They also give you a buzzer to let you know when the food is ready... Which is fine if I have to come get my food but if you're going to bring it to me anyways then what's the point of giving me a buzzer? Just seems like a pointless extra step. Once my food got to me I asked which taco was which because all 3 were very different and the server said he didn't know and walked off. That's unacceptable. I had to get up and look at the menu in the storefront again to remember which was which.

Drinks: My date and I each had a margarita. She had the special of the day and I had the catalina. They were both delicious but very alcohol light. They were also served in plastic cups which seemed cheap for a not so cheap drink. There is also the added inconvenience of having to order each drink individually and then get up in the middle of your meal, walk to the front of the store, and pay for your next drink. ??? That is a really bad business model for selling alcohol. As a restaurant your highest profit margin should be from your alcohol sales. You should make ordering alcoholic drinks as easy as possible to maximize your revenue and customer satisfaction.

Food: The food is quite possibly the most disappointing part of my experience. Not because it was bad, but because it was nothing. I ordered 3 tacos with chips and queso. I had the Russian Roulette, The Outlaw, and The Lonestar. Each pretty unique in their overly complicated design and odd amalgamation of ingredients that are essentially slopped into a flour tortilla in an effort to ensure I have the messiest taco eating experience of my life. There was so many different ingredients in these tacos that I was expecting to have a symphony of spicy flavors and aromas accompany these gorgeous tacos, but there were so many random ingredients on each one that just don't work together that I couldn't taste anything. So many flavors working against each other just for the sake of having more "artisanal" ingredients on your taco. I had 3 very different tacos and they all tasted the same... Like paprika sprinkled on cardboard. That may sound harsh but it's honestly the closest comparison I can make. You would also think that at a place that serves a cuisine known for its spiciness that I would expect to get a good kick in the mouth out of 3 of its spiciest tacos but I'll be honest.. I had hot wings from zaxby's last night that were far hotter.

Overall not the worst experience I've ever had but this seems like the type of place that trendy hipsters frequent so they can make instagram posts about "artisan" tacos and feel Californian for a day.

name: Josh Roberts
text: This great food truck finally found a fixed location. I had the special which was brisket burnt ends on a brioche bun with pickles and slaw. It was really really good, incredibly decadent well seasoned meat inside a pillowy buttery bun. I had chips and green salsa as the side. Everyone there was friendly and the restaurant was really clean. Highly recommended

name: Chris S
text:
It's always good! The Cattleman Bowl is great for takeout and even good the next day reheated. They put enough in it that you can definitely have it for lunch the next day.

Everything I've tried here has been pretty good. Tacos, burritos, and the brisket. And their staff seems to pretty helpful also!

name: Jennifer Champlin
text: Absolutly delicious local spot. After living in places like Phoenix and Sand Diego, I have snobbish standards for tacos. This place was amazing. It has a great variety of things fresh and inventive and unique.  It's a little unimpressive in the counter and bar area, but ignore that.

name: Rodney Danbery
text: I do not recommend this eatery! Customer service, worst I've ever experienced! Food so, so!

resp.text: Mr. Rodney, it is difficult for me to read this review you have written after our history we've had for so many years.  Honestly, at first I didn't believe this was you.  You, the man that would hang out our bar and talk motorcycle travels, family, and military.  Mr. Rodney, we'd spend plenty of time talking about food and our passions.  I'm saddened that you wouldn't recommend our eatery after eating here since we've been open.  You know us.  You know that if there was ever any issue with ANYTHING what so ever that I would want to hear about it straight from you, person to person, and you should know after ALL these years that I would make it right, to anyone, but especially to you.  Mr. Rodney, you know that our staff (my restaurant family) has been through hell this past year due to COVID.  We appreciate you and have always appreciated your support.  If you were trying to get my attention as an owner by writing a vague one star review, well you certainly got it.  But I ask you, as a long time patron and as a person I considered a friend, that you reconsider your review and speak to me in person about your experience.  From a veteran owned business, family owned business, to you a local veteran... at the very least, give me the opportunity to speak with you and try to fix whatever issue might have occurred tonight.  Afterwards if you still feel the exact same as you do now, you may write whatever review you'd like; but I would appreciate the opportunity to try.  I look forward to speaking with you soon, sir.  - LeAndra P. (Owner)

name: Shawker 71
text: Unfortunately I have not tried to many items from the menu yet. The one thing I do love that they have is the brussel sprouts. It sounds crazy but they are amazing.

name: Theresa McIlwain
